review_text: My son and I stayed here for a Beaver Creek ski trip. The location is perfect, very close to town and the ski mountain. Very clean, Matt has thought of everything. There were only two of us, but the condo would be perfect for up to 6. The living room is comfortable with a fireplace perfect for after a long day of skiing, and the kitchen is large and well stocked. Matt was very communicative before the trip and available for whatever we needed. I’d highly recommend Matt’s condo for your stay!

Very cozy apartment in a quiet place and very close to Beaver Creek and Vail station ( about 10 minutes or a little longer). Very well equipped, everything we needed in the apartment, in addition to Courtesy of coffee capsules, dish soap and clothes, hygiene kit in the bathroom, among others.
Bed in the largest room very comfortable, tasty fireplace in the living room.
Quick in-response host and extremely polite. There was a book with nearby restaurant recommendations and basic guidelines.
Finally, I will miss our space and we will certainly be back. were wonderful days!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Location was so convenient for walking EVERYWHERE! The lake is so close, and the views were amazing! Lots of little conveniences in the unit - camp chairs to take to the lake to watch the sunset; some staples for kitchen that were a nice convenience; even some games/puzzles if there had been more time - we did play cards, so that was kind of fun. My son said the murphy bed mattress was very comfortable too. I most especially liked sitting in the morning sun on the patio with my coffee, and sitting in the bedroom nook at night, reading. Very cozy and welcoming space. I will DEFINITELY be back!

name: Virginia
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
2 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Well, where do I start? My husband and I had the best time! It was extremely easy to work with the host and we had everything we needed for a fun relaxing time! Avon/Beaver creek is a must see prime location. We were incredibly impressed with the condo. It is very cozy and VERY clean. The view is out of this world. It was very quiet at night. It is close to the elevators and easy to park and get in and out of the garage. The shower was hot and had great water pressure. The beds were comfortable and clean! It is close to great restaurants, shopping and the grocery store, which were all in walking distance or a short drive. There is so much to do and see, we will definitely be heading back!!

review_text: This is a great place! Super clean with high-end finishes. It’s very quiet and within walking distance to several stores and restaurants. It has a fantastic mountain view from the balcony and living area. The bed was very comfortable and the unit’s washer and dryer came in handy. It’s a wonderful place to stay in Avon. We’ll for sure stay here again!

name: Vic
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Location, Location, Location!! Everything you would want or need to do is within a 5 minute walk, including the Westin Gondola, which is just across the street. I was able to walk to the lake, restaurants, bars and shopping.
Once you get there, you won't need your car anymore, but the heated, underground garage was a nice perk as were the elevators so I didn't have to lug my stuff up 3 flights of stairs!
The unit itself was very welcoming and clean. Everything I needed was in the kitchen and they even had a stocked spice rack!
My favorite part was sitting on the private balcony and enjoying the great views of Beaver Creek. And get this, the gas grill actually lit with the clicker switch!
It was a great escape and I look forward to returning.

name: Joanna And Drew
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We had a really nice stay at this property. We stayed here with our 2 kids (1 year and 3 years old) and the grandparents. We all had plenty of space and privacy and the bedrooms are on separate floors. This is a very well maintained condo and is free of clutter but also has everything you need! The kitchen is newly redone, has high end appliances, and is very well organized and equipped. The grill was clean and easy to use. Extra A+ points for the black out shades in the kids bunk room which was essential for naps!! The beds were extremely comfortable and the neighborhood was quiet. We enjoyed using the hot tub after skiing at the nearby resorts (Beaver Creek and Vail). The property is walkable to downtown Edwards (although we didn’t walk cause we stayed in the winter) and we enjoyed the local restaurants nearby. FYI - a suburban sized car will not fit in the garage but there is parking in the drive way. I would highly recommend this property to anyone looking to visit the area!

review_text: This place is beautiful and cozy. We felt right at home. It had so many board and card games for us to enjoy as a family as well as extras such as Qtips, cotton balls, shampoo/conditioner in the bathrooms. name: Brian
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: We took a weekend trip for some spring skiing at Beaver Creek. The house was as listed and with a bonus of having a crib and toys for the kids! The host was very responsive to all questions and even allowed a late check out so we could get the kids packed. The hot tub was a very close walk in the backyard and was very warm & inviting! The beds were comfortable. They had extra linens, towels for the hot tub, and a well-stocked kitchen. There was plenty of parking (even when we brought three cars!) Only difficulty we had was finding the place (internet directions are wrong) but the host had provided a map with clear instructions. Beaver creek was a quick 10-15 minute drive and there was excellent coffee within 4 minutes. Overall, an excellent & peaceful spring stay in Edwards!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Brett’s place was exactly as listed, exactly as described. His check-in instructions were prompt, clear, and helpful. The area is beautiful and quiet with a clear view of the mountains. Internet worked well so it’s a good spot for working remotely. Close to beaver creek and vail if you have a car. Shuttle is a bit more tedious but doable. Bit of a trek to the stop though if you have all your ski gear. They also have a pretty solid amount of pots / pans / cooking and even baking utensils if you plan to use the kitchen. Electric stove though.
Definitely would stay again. Price was reasonable and it’s one of the few remaining airbnbs I’ve encountered that just includes everything in the listed price without adding on cleaning fees / whatever other fees at the end.

The kitchen is spacious and also the best equipped that we’ve ever stayed at. We liked sitting on the porch with our coffee and watching the yellow aspens in the evening and watching the sunrise over the local mountains in the morning and deer chomping the neighbors’ foliage across the cul-de-sac. It was a quiet refuge away from the more frenetic Vail Village downtown area, but just a quick drive down the freeway to get there. We would like to go back again.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: I can't say enough about the host or this property. Brett has gone beyond to make our stay enjoyable and worry free. He realized how late we will be checking in, so he offered to get us groceries. When we got to the property, he had water (very important), eggs, bread, etc. just to get us started. The place was awesome. The bed was very comfortable. My son (6' tall) slept on the couch and never once complaint. There's an electric fireplace in the bedroom which was very nice cuz it can get cold at night. There's also 2nd fireplace in the living area, so it makes the place very comfortable. Many places that I've stayed, the utensils drawers and cabinets were always dirty. But this property was very well kept from the bathroom to the kitchen. Definitely will stay here again. Thank you, Brett.

name: Andres
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2019
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
LOTS OF POSITIVES:
Host: Brett is a great host, friendly and very responsive to any questions or requests.
Apartment: Very spacious. A separate bedroom provides a degree of privacy, the kitchen/dining area has ample space for preparing and eating meals, and the living room has ample space for relaxing/lounging around -- including a gas fireplace that gives it a nice cozy feel.
Location: Outstanding. The apartment is 5 minutes from the main shopping area of Edwards, which includes a City Market, bank, several ski/cycle/outdoor sports shops, clothing boutiques, restaurants, and other services. If you're a skier, you will be about 5 minutes from Beaver Creek's Arrowhead lift, about 10 minutes from its main parking lots in Avon, and about 20 minutes from Vail's Lionshead gondola parking. Nearby nonskiing options include the thermal spas at Glenwood Springs (less than an hour away), the red-rock mountain biking areas of western Colorado & eastern Utah (several hours away), and lots of local snowshoeing/hiking trails.
THINGS TO CONSIDER:
The apartment does not have any closets or an armoire to hang up clothes, so consider bringing your own clothesline and plastic hangers, and improvise.

There's free parking in town (somewhat limited so get there early) and either the Skier Shuttle bus or the Gondola will get you to the ski area. When I go skiing I hit the slopes hard during the day and like coming back to a comfortable place where I can relax and cook for myself. Brett's place provides both, a nice gas fireplace and a full kitchen: full size fridge, oven, microwave, and dishwasher. Overall a very pleasant place to stay.

Group trip
review_text: Solid stay. Starting with the pros: the place is very large and has plenty of space. The pricing is really great for the area and the property is gorgeous. It was nice to have plenty of linens and the place was just easy. The managers were incredibly responsive and friendly when we reached out. The cons: the pool and hot tub are only open 10am-8pm (not super convenient if you're out doing things all day- but this is beyond the manager's control). The unit is somewhat dated, but comfortable and priced well below other units in the area. There are some things that are just getting old and need updating (the grill is rusted, broken, and unusable, the lights flicker on and off in the kitchen and there is a lack of lighting around the place, the fireplace was shut off- etc, the pullout sofa was hard to use....). Overall- definitely worth the price and the size of the unit and the responsiveness and friendliness of the host made the difference!

name: Laura
rating_info:
Rating, 1 star
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
BED BUGS. Stay away from this condo!
I got eaten alive the first night that we stayed in this unit (Sunday, September 4th, 2022) - 16 bites on one arm and 4 on the other. I slept in the master bedroom that night, alone, and was the only one to have bites. Unfortunately the bites surfaced late the next day, too late for us to check out and go elsewhere as we were traveling with a 2 year old. No one slept in the master bedroom the 2nd night.
I notified the hosts of the bed bug problem the next morning. They never even acknowledged my message. Then I reported it to AirBnb. They worked with me to get at least a partial refund, after sending them photos of the bites and a doctor’s note confirming they were bed bug bites. Everything about the bites was consistent with bed bugs. I am also all too familiar with them as this is the fourth time i have dealt with this in my life (the last time being over a decade ago).
Throughout all if this, the hosts never even acknowledged my message. I learned through AirBnb that they hired a pest control company to inspect the condo and they did not find any bed bugs. I don’t know how one would find them during the day in a condo covered in carpet and wood furniture. The only way to know for certain is if someone reports bites. You would have to completely tear apart a unit to find them as they can also live in the walls.
I appreciate AirBnb for working with me and for refunding at least the cleaning and service fees. I’ve lost several nights of sleep, endured excruciating bites, spent time with a doctor, and purchased prescription strength itch cream (these are way worse than mosquito bites). It’s now been 10 days since we checked out and my arms still look terrible although they feel considerably better. Not worth it for a 2-night stay in the mountains!! I would recommend staying at a hotel instead, which would at least have acknowledged the problem and likely refunded all of my money.
In addition, these hosts seem to be a group of three men who communicate different pieces of information about your stay. It’s disjointed and confusing. They send automated messages that are not accurate.
The best parts of our stay were the playgrounds across the street and the heated pool, which our toddler loved. These are community features though that serve multiple buildings, not just this condo building.
If you do consider staying at this unit, I would recommend asking to see documentation of full bed bug extermination (not just a report of inspection).
What an awful experience.

The hot tub was very nice - about a 2 minute walk from the condo. A code is required to access it and we had to ask for the code.
We were also provided an incorrect code to gain access to the garage and building. This was remedied but it did take about 15 minutes to get ahold of anyone to help. In general, response time was generally 1-2hrs, which could be improved.
Overall, the access to laundry, the location close to a shuttle and ski lift, the jetted hot tub, the comfortable beds (would recommend to bring your own pillow - the ones provided were not great), spacious living room with a fireplace, the and the large kitchen made it generally a very pleasant stay. We would stay again and have provided the hosts with specifics that could be improved to make it even better.

name: Nicholas

Rating, 3 stars
,

,

Stayed one night
review_text:
First off, I stayed at many ski-resort condos in the 1990s and 2000s. We were rather disappointed with the Edwards condo. First of all, the directions provided were difficult to follow. On our first trip in, we asked the security guard for a parking hangtag but he said we didn’t need it. The second time, we needed to talk to the (different) guard and finally got a hangtag. It would have been helpful for the guard station to have been told in advance that we were authorized and expected, especially as I did not recognize that the listing was in a gated community until after booking.
Once we entered the condo, we did not find any directions for guests, how to do common tasks such as adjusting the AC, or what to do at checkout. The master bedroom had a stained duvet cover, no clock or wastebasket (certainly essential in the time of Covid), no chair or other place to put small objects, and feeble lighting. The mattress and pillows were quite uncomfortable, with the memory foam unevenly worn. The presence of a pack of toilet seat covers on the HP printer was quite odd. The wireless internet network name and password were provided with incorrect capitalization. The wrong network name could have connected us to a hacker, and the wrong password simply didn’t work.
In the morning we noticed that two doors leading to the outside were not locked. None of us opened these doors, so we suspect they had not been locked before our arrival. In short, we believe that the price we paid for an off-season rental was way too steep.

review_text:
The group I was in communicated with Jeff about an early check in and everything was good! He was very friendly. However, when I booked the stay I immediately noticed from the address that his location was not in Aspen - where we had searched / planned to stay. I immediately canceled (this all happened within a 10 min time frame). I contacted Airb&b support for a full refund since it was a genuine mistake but Jeff kept the entire $170. A genuine mistake costed me $170 and he has not responded to AirB&B efforts to contact him to issue a full refund.
Although I do see his cancellation policy, it’s saddening that people are this money hungry. I thought he was in Aspen, his location is not AFTER the fact. The least he could have done was provide a 75% refund. I can’t expect others to have the same morals as me, I’m sure he is a decent host I was just surprised by his lack of empathy regarding my situation.

review_text: This condo was in a great location for accessing the ArrowBahn 17 lift at Beaver Creek Resort – only a short walk, even for kids. Great playground right across the road for younger kids and easy access to hiking trails too. The condo was a ground-floor corner unit and quite spacious with a big kitchen. We enjoyed the two balconies as well. Clean and well-kept with nice homey touches. Great building with ski lockers and underground heated parking. Hosts were easy to communicate with and responsive to questions. Highly recommend!

name: Aliya
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
March 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
There weren’t any reviews when we booked so we were a little nervous but the place was a great value for the money. It is about a block and half downhill from the lift which is a bit of a hike in ski boots but it was doable. The village of Arrowhead is small but we really enjoyed the free shuttle that takes you to Bachelor Gulch and Beaver Creek.
The condo itself is very spacious, the beds were comfortable and it had everything we needed. There’s a coffee maker, lots of pots and pans and large table to play games, along with a PS4 with games and tv and a washer/dryer. You’ll need to bring your own spices if you want anything besides salt/pepper. They did have oil and coffee.
We were disappointed about the hot tubs being closed but that’s no fault of the owners. We did enjoy the large bath tub after a long day on the slopes. The hosts were very responsive and accommodated all our requests.

Easy access to starting a ski day at Arrowhead and heated garage with ability to have your car in was money!! Highly recommend for a family with adult children. We used the grill (gas, attached to a gas line) and bonfire pit quite a bit. The kitchen has ample cooking pots, pans & utensils.
The check in instructions were clear and easy. I had a few questions for Tara and she responded quickly. If we return to the Edwards area in the future I would not hesitate to book this house again.

name: Lisa
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2019
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The house was just perfect for our annual Friendtrip. It was clean, well-decorated, and cozy. No detail was missed- there were hair dryers in all the bathrooms, lovely toiletries, and beautiful decor. The gas fireplace was perfect for our first night- it was quite cold and rainy- but the fireplace warmed us up in no time! This house was a great place for kids, too- books for bedtime stories, awesome nooks and crannies for hide and seek, and a whole drawer of kids plates and cups in the kitchen. The kitchen had everything we needed and was spacious enough to have many cooks prepping food. Plus there was tons of pantry storage for our stock of snacks for the week. Our group of 11 had plenty of space to dine together. We loved the patio; the umbrella was great for the warm afternoon sun and the fire pit was perfect for s'mores. The grill had all the tools we needed for a night of brats and burgers, too. We caught glimpses of deer in the yard almost every morning and evening and even spotted a few rainbows during our stay. The en suite bathrooms in every bedroom were so nice- made it so much easier to get everyone ready each morning. The location was great- super close to town, an easy drive to Vail, the grocery store and several parks. A delicious bagel place was a short walk down the hill and several restaurants we enjoyed (the Craftsman, Gore Range Brewery, Hovey and Harrison, and the Smiling Moose) were just minutes away. This was easily one of our favorite rentals. Couldn't have asked for a better experience at Tara's Edwards house! Thanks, Tara, for giving us a great space to make some wonderful memories!!

We don’t like the traditional log homes that are very dark and often not child friendly. This home is a great space for families. The Edwards neighborhood is warmer, less touristy and much better value than central vail. Shops and restaurants are within walking distance and the neighborhood is quiet with lots of deer roaming around. Nice back patio and fire pit. Great for a long term visit with friends and family.

review_text: Jeff’s place was clean and accurate in what we expected. However, there were quite a few things that were unexpected. We have rented multiple Airbnb’s and have never had an owners personal things like clothes openly visible in the closet and accessible. It is more of a bachelors pad feel including the “cheeky” underwear flag hanging in the bathroom. Not an issue with us but could be for a younger family or another guest. Some kitchen items were missing including the coffee carafe, sponge to clean the dishes and bathtub stopper in one of the bathrooms. The managers did respond very quickly to replacing the coffee maker and we just made do with the other things. very dated. Some of the stove burners didn’t work and were not seated properly. We simply decided not to complain since we skied two days and didn’t want to make arrangements to fix everything. All in all, it was a decent stay but could have been much better.

,

November 2021
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Four years since we last visited Edwards and Jeff’s place worked out great for us. It has a wonderful view of the river and the mountains. It has nice easy access and is close, but not in the downtown business area, which we found to be a plus. The living area was spacious and comfortable for my husband and I. Our stay was for seven days so we did use all the appliances. The stacking laundry unit worked great and was easy to use. The dishwasher has some miles on it but when run on “pots & pans” mode did a good job of cleaning.
Our contact Randy went out of his way for us with our extra parking that we needed. During our stay we had a couple of questions with TV operation and an issue with a neighbor making some noise a little late in the afternoon for our liking, Randy was available and responsive right away taking care of the noise problem and answering our TV questions.
Our hosts provided plenty of clean and fluffy towels. We found the bed comfortable and the feather comforter kept us warm and cozy for our late November visit.
Hoping we get back to Edwards again one day and will definitely contact Jeff and Randy to book our stay.

Stayed about a week
review_text:
Julie is a super host!! Communication with her was always easy and fast. Correct check-in & check-out.
The house is amazing, large and comfortable.
Fantastic room and private bathroom, very spacious everything. The bed is very comfortable, with winter sheets, several pillows and several blankets available apart from the comforter. Great closet and dresser to place clothes. There is a good fridge in the room which is great!! The perfect heating temperature. There is a humifier to counteract the dry air of the heater (95% of the houses in the USA have air heating). The perfect shower and hot water, also has a hair dryer.
Exquisite cleanliness, everything's super clean.
We were able to use the kitchen, which has been a very important plus to us.
Location is also perfect if you are going skiing, as has been in our case. 6 minutes from the nearest Beavier Creek lift and 15 minutes from Vail by car. Edwards is connected to the ski resorts via several bus lines, but it would take you longer (to Vail 52 minutes).
Definitely the best quality/price option in the entire Vail Valley. I recommend it without any doubt.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A wonderful retreat, is the TLDR version of this review.
In a once in a blue moon accident, in a flash, the entire power grid in the town was shut off. A city-wide blackout. While we panicked trying to find candles and flashlights we were greeted by a friendly knock not even five minutes into the blackout. Our lovely host checked-in on us and graciously provided flashlights to use.
If there is no other way to say that we had a calm and restful retreat, I'm not sure how else to put it. During our stay we never worried about anything and felt right at home...for the duration our PTO allowed us at least.

There are two sleeping areas, a small kitchen equipped with what you need, a washer and dryer, and the icing on the cake is access to the upper deck with stunning views. They allowed our giant German shepherd to stay and even let me borrow their vacuum to keep the hair away when I started going crazy with it. Kaleb and Abby were very available and accommodating but not at all intrusive. We didn’t even know they were there until they were right away available to answer questions. They gave us great ideas for hikes and activities that really made our week special. This was a mother/son trip that wasn’t just a baseball tournament. I’ll never forget it and Kaleb and Abby are a big part of that.

review_text:
“The Ritz of Eagle, CO!”
Simply the best time possible in the Vail Valley. Whether we were skiing the resorts, hiking, fly fishing, you name it, this was the single best place we could have possibly stayed. Kaleb and Abby are phenomenal hosts. Such great amenities. Lots of advice and benefits, including how to snow mobile, snowshoe, and do any and all things outdoors. Their place is close to the ECO bus stop, with a Park & Ride, the local grocery store, and the Eagle River. 20 mins to BC, 30 mins to Vail, and less than 10 mins to EGE airport. 11/10 stay. A+ on all counts. Will try and stay with them again!

review_text: Fantastic location on Riverwalk in Edwards with restaurants and shops as well as beautiful walking trail all at your doorstep. Beaver Creek is a mere 5 minutes away and Vail 15 minutes for easy access to skiing. Pet friendly with pet stations along the Riverwalk including poop bags and bins. The condo has everything you need and is lovely. We cooked most nights post skiing and Village Market is within a few minutes walk if we needed anything. The deck is lovely with grill, seating and river views. Host was proactive, responsive, friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend.

Stayed over a week
review_text: David’s place was perfect. I was needing a comfortable place to rehab after knee replacement surgery. It was great. Basement indoor heated garage with an elevator. What better than that post surgery? His instructions were crystal clear and even though the elevator had a small mechanical issue it was up and running in no time. I think that would not be the case if I was dealing with those large management companies. This is a very nice place and you deal with a family that loves their place in a little slice of heaven. There are plenty of walkable places like restaurants, food market and theaters. My only regret will be that I was not able to enjoy all the amenities as I was on crutches. We will be back and ready to run. Highly recommended!

David’s place was less than 10 minutes from the venue (Park Hyatt). It was private, clean, had 2 large bathrooms and bedrooms. The living area was very comfortable and homey, and there was a deck with a lovely river view. We slept with the window open and had the lovely sound of the river as background music We did not use the kitchen, but had we needed to it had everything we could have needed. We really appreciated the filtered water in the fridge, as well as shampoo and body wash in the showers. Literally a stones throw away are a big variety of food options as well. If we ever return to the area I would absolutely stay here again.

David’s place was perfect! We were looking for something outside of the busy resorts during the summer months to get away from the southern heat/humidity.
The river just across the walking path drowns out everything and made for an extremely relaxing atmosphere especially with the afternoon rains. It was great grilling steaks with the family!
Just leave the windows open with the screens closed at night (and the portable A/C on if your visiting during the summer months from the the south). We will definitely be coming back again!

name: Jennifer
rating_info:

,

Stayed with kids
review_text:
David’s Stellar Condo is indeed stellar. The location is convenient to the parks, shops and excellent restaurants of Edwards, there is plenty of parking, and walking paths along the river that go all the way to neighboring towns in the valley.
The condo itself backs up to a rushing river which lulled us to sleep at night through our open windows. The balcony also overlooks the river and was an peaceful spot for evening toddies and morning coffee.
The kitchen is stocked with everything we needed to cook meals, the beds were comfy, the couch deep and firm—great for watching tv and afternoon naps. The bedrooms are on opposite ends of the layout, allowing for privacy. Same goes for the bathrooms.
And—clean! The unit was sparkling clean. The host was super helpful and communicative. We would for sure come back and stay at the Stellar!

Group trip
review_text:
We had a perfect stay at this Airbnb. The house is beautifully situated on a hillside looking over stunning Colorado wilderness. We saw multiple wild animals including elk and deer in the mornings. The house is clean, perfectly laid out, and boasts a well equipped kitchen (2 sinks!). Each evening we gathered in the dining room and the large den area to play board games after epic ski days at Vail and Beaver Creek. The hot tub works great and the location is terrific for exploring the surrounding area.
I would be remiss to exclude praise for the extremely responsive and accommodating management team. They helped part of our group access the property early and were attentive to our questions (9x12 pans for lasagna?) and messages throughout the period before and after our stay. This management team really stood out and we will try to book here first next time we stay in the area!

This was an amazing place to stay for our group of 10 to use as we hit Beaver Creek and Vail. The place was immaculately clean and the listing is accurate. The beds are very comfy, the water pressure was great, and there was plenty of hot water for everyone. The view is spectacular, and having the hot tub and sauna after a day on the slopes is a dream come true.
There were a couple of maintenance issues (a cabinet door fell off and the back of a dining chair started falling apart), but the management company was very responsive and offered to repair or replace these things right away. The kitchen has most of the essentials but if you need something particular you may need to bring it. We would definitely stay here again!

name: David
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
October 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Great location, big spacious home in a gorgeous neighborhood, good floor plan, with access to shops and stores. But home really needs an update. Finishes and furniture feel out of date.
The home is in a great location, in a beautiful neighborhood. There is access to a trail system right behind the house, with great views of the mountains and surrounding area. There are walking trails all around the neighborhood. The home has great outdoor space, a big back yard, a hot tub, and a sauna. The neighborhood apparently has quiet hours which I understand but restricting hot tub use to 9pm on weekdays and 10pm on weekends seems excessive. The owner has likely had issues with people making a lot of noise and I assume has had to make these restrictions.
The neighborhood location is great, with good access to shops and stores and quick access to highway.
The home has a great floor plan and is very spacious. The garage is heated. Upstairs is the mud room, office area, kitchen, dining area, living room, and master bedroom and bathroom which is large and spacious as well. The master has great views out into the mountains
Downstairs is 4 bedrooms and two full bathrooms as well as another living room, and access to the backyard.

review_text: Beautiful neighborhood and close to walking paths and restaurants and such. Stunning master bed woodworking but bed was terribly uncomfortable with noticeable sagging in middle. Fortunately, the other bed was fine. There is only window and it feels claustrophobic and we could not figure out out thermostat to get warmer or cooler and host did not respond to an email about it. I understand that trash needs to be in garage due to wildlife but it was very smelly. Having a garage to park in was nice especially if you were to be there in the winter. Host did have all the amenities you would need such as coffee, sugar, etc.

name: Charles
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
March 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Michael’s place is a great choice for couples or small parties who are wanting to stay in the eagle county/vail area. It is very spacious, and has all the amenities one could ask for, including a; washer/dryer, kitchen, fridge, garage, heated fireplace, Netflix on the tv, toaster, WiFi, and 2 beds in the bedroom. The location is great as you are roughly 30 minutes from the airport and about 20 minutes from vail. For the price and location, this may be one of the best options for anyone on a budget.
The unit does look like the pictures as advertised, but it wasn’t as clean as we had hoped for. The floor was dusty, had what looked like some dried mud, food, and other debris, which was disappointing. The towels also were stained a bit. The noise from the toilet was quite loud, sometimes going off in the night. We did have a problem with the toilet, it stopped working and started leaking, but Michael promptly fixed it while we were out.
Overall this place is a good choice if you want decent quality for a good price. The unit could use some touching up, as it really has the potential to be one of the nicest places in the area. I would recommend for anyone wanting to go for a ski vacation who cannot afford the $500 a night resorts.

name: Daniel
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Really cute and spacious basement apartment! Having the garage as the entrance was great for bringing our stuff in and letting our snowboards dry. The bed and blankets were super comfortable and the living room area was very cozy. There was a space heater if we needed it. The TV had a guest Netflix account available for use which was very convenient.
The kitchenette had a full fridge, sink, dishwasher, two electric burners, microwave, and coffee maker. When I tried to use the electric burners and coffee maker at the same time (different outlets) it tripped the breaker so I’d use just one appliance at a time.
The water pumps are a bit loud when using the toilet or any running water, but not bad at all. We could hear movement from our hosts above during the day, but not at all disruptive (like living in an apartment) and very quiet at night.
About 15 minutes from Beaver Creek and Vail parking lots, great location.

review_text: The place is valued at a good price. Although, there is unfinished/ poor craftsmanship throughout the place. Missing drywall, lack of towels, no soap. There was no instructional on how to leave the place. The light in the living room was flickering non stop. Food left in the fridge. Host didn’t reach out at any point.

name: Gabriella
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2021
,
·
Group trip
review_text: An amazing space with a super responsive and helpful host, who responded immediately to all messages! We had problems with the fuses but Michael helped us reset the correct ones, and the space was super clean and tidy and comfortable for 4 people. We parked in the garage so our ski gear was safe, and the host generously provided us a space heater and 3 tide pods so we could dry our ski boots and do laundry. What’s great too is that the grocery store is super close, so we were able to grab some dish soap for scrubbing before placing dishes in the dishwasher as the previous soap was low. As a tip, We brought our own shampoo and body wash and precooked meals. I’d recommend pre-cooking portions of big meals before coming; the portable stove top has one big burner and one small burner which is great for simple meals like canned soup, but not so great if you’re trying to cook from scratch for 4 people. There was one large metal pan and one ceramic pot, I’d bring a larger pasta pot or precooked pasta like we did. There is a Queen and then a twin XL in the bedroom, the twin is creaky so our sound-sensitive friend slept on the couch (not even the pull out bed) and was very comfortable!! Overall we were very pleased with our stay, and recommend Michael and his unit as a great option for people checking out the epic pass resorts! We were 10-15 min from Beaver and 20 min from Vail.

The room is huge and so is the king size bed, which was very comfortable. Very cute decor and the apartment gets warm very quickly. Only complaint is that you can hear EVERYTHING from upstairs. Every conversation, music, tv, etc. and at night time If you’re a light sleeper the noise from the pipes or heating unit (not sure which one it was) is very loud. It sounds like someone is knocking on the door all night but it’s just the click clack of the pipes. I have a white noise app on my phone so we just turned it on all night but if you don’t then the noise might keep you up.
